author: Staff Reporter
text:
The wholesale price of egg in the Namakkal Zone will remain at Rs. 4.02 for another one week after which price is expected to increase.

The zone continues to be the second highest egg production centre in the country with over 3.05 crore eggs produced everyday. The National Egg Coordination Committee (NECC), Namakkal Zone fixes the price of egg three times a week based on the demand and supply of eggs in the market. On December 24, 2015, the price was fixed at Rs. 4.02. Committee chairman P. Selvaraj expressed the hope that wholesale price of egg will rise after a week due to increase in demand.

He said that Kerala was the main market for eggs produced in Namakkal Zone. The end of Sabarimala season has increased the demand.

After the end of Thaipusam on January 24, the demand will increase fruther, he added.
title: Wholesale price of egg to remain at Rs. 4.02
